list.title: Question 1
list.content: Jurgen is a scientist working for NASA.He maintains a telescope that is in orbit around the Earth.To test the accuracy of the telescope he uses it to measure the radius of the Earth.The radius of the Earth is known to be63781376\hspace{0.1em}378\hspace{0.1em}1376378137metres.Jurgen measures the radius of the Earth to be64324006\hspace{0.1em}432\hspace{0.1em}4006432400metres. What is the percentage error in his measurement?[2]Jurgen useshismeasurement to calculate the circumference of the Earth. He assumes the Earth is spherical.What value for the circumference of the Earth does Jurgen obtain? Round your answer to444significant figures.Write down the answer to part (b)(i) in the forma×10ka\times10^ka×10k, where1≤a<101\leq a<101≤a<10andk∈Zk\in \mathbb{Z}k∈Z.[3]

list.title: Question 5
list.content:
LetQ=(sin⁡2x+b)(2sin⁡x−1)a2−4tan⁡xQ = \dfrac{(\sin 2x + b)(2\sin x - 1)}{a^2 - 4\tan x}Q=a2−4tanx(sin2x+b)(2sinx−1)​, wherex=45°x = \ang{45}x=45°,a=18a = 18a=18andb=2b = \sqrt{2}b=2​.Find theexactvalue ofQQQ.[2]Give your answer topart (a)correct tothree decimal places;three significant figures.[2]Calculate the percentage error ifQQQis given to three decimal

list.title: Question 6
list.content:

list.title: Question 7
list.content:
Four cement bags labelled, "5 kg", were
delivered to a customer. The customer measured each bag to check their
weights and recorded the following:4.92,4.95,5.02,4.95\begin{aligned}
4.92,\hspace{0.3em} 4.95,\hspace{0.3em} 5.02,\hspace{0.3em}4.95 \\
\end{aligned}4.92,4.95,5.02,4.95​Find the mean of the customer's measurements.Calculate the percentage error between the mean and the stated,approximate weight of555kg.[3]Calculate2.158−5.12−0.8\sqrt{2.15^8-5.12^{-0.8}}2.158−5.12−0.8​, giving your answercorrect to the nearest integer;in the forma×10ka\times10^ka×10k, where1≤a<101 \leq a < 101≤a<10andk∈Zk\in \mathbb{Z}k∈Z.[3]

list.title: Question 8
list.content:

Give your answer correct to three significant figures.[3]Give your answer frompart (a)correct to one decimal place.[1]Write the answer topart (b)in the forma×10ka\times10^ka×10k, where1≤a<101 \leq a < 101≤a<10,k∈Zk \in \mathbb{Z}k∈Z.[2]

list.title: Question 9
list.content:

Write down the area of the rectangle in the forma×10ka\times10^ka×10k,
where1≤a<101 \leq a < 101≤a<10andk∈Zk \in \mathbb{Z}k∈Z.[3]Natalie estimates the area of the rectangle to be12000001\hspace{0.1em}200\hspace{0.15em}0001200000cm2^22.Find the percentage error in Natalie's estimate.[3]

list.title: Question 10
list.content: A cuboid has the following dimensions:length=9.6\text{length} = 9.6\hspace{0.25em}length=9.6cm,width=7.4\text{width} = 7.4\hspace{0.25em}width=7.4cm, andheight=5.2\text{height} = 5.2\hspace{0.25em}height=5.2cm, measured correct to thenearest millimetre.Using these measurements, calculate the volume of the cuboid, in cm3^33. Give your answer to two decimal places.[2]The lower and upper bounds for the length of the cuboid can be expressed as9.55≤l<9.659.55 \leq l < 9.659.55≤l<9.65.Write similar expressions forthe width;the height.[2]Hence, calculate theminimumvolume of the cuboid. Give your answer to three significant figures.[2]Write your answer topart (c)in the forma×10ka\times10^ka×10k, where1≤a<101 \leq a < 101≤a<10andk∈Zk \in \mathbb{Z}k∈Z.[2]

list.title: Question 11
list.content: LetF=(4sin⁡2z−1)(2tan⁡3z+1)x2−y2F = \dfrac{(4\sin 2z-1)(2\tan 3z+1)}{x^2-y^2}F=x2−y2(4sin2z−1)(2tan3z+1)​, wherex=12x = 12x=12,y=8y = 8y=8andz=15°z = \ang{15}z=15°.Calculate theexactvalue ofFFF.[2]Give your answer toFFFcorrect totwo significant figures;two decimal places.[2]Sasha estimates the value ofFFFto be0.030.030.03.Calculate the percentage error in Sasha's estimate.[2]
